p: After organizing, the data were fed into SPSS version 22 and then analyzed. To compare the mean PPS, MST, changes in mean body weight, PCV, and rectal temperature of the P. berghei-infected mice between the extract received groups and the controls and among the extract received groups, one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) followed by Tukey post hoc test was done. p value less than 0.05 was considered to be statistically significant with analysis at 95% confidence interval.
